crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
When standing a web application up, the crnrstn :: class object serves as the cornerstone block...securely joining the "wall" of the hosting environment to the "wall" of your application. When instantiating the class object, simply pass in the $_SERVER super global array, and crnrstn will absorb the characteristics of that particular hosting environment...then itself becoming the interface between the application and web server at critical and specified locations.
Access to the crnrstn :: class object is managed by the environmentals :: class object, and so upon the instantiation and configuring of crnrstn, the environmentals :: class object should be prepared immediately. Thenceforth, all references to content that would have otherwise been made available directly through the crnrstn :: class object...will be accessed through the environmentals :: class object instead. See the documentation for the environmentals :: class for more information about how the application can access environmentally specific parameters relating to the hosting environment as it was configured through the crnrstn :: class object.
